SEARCH

Class Worker

java.lang.Object
Worker
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Worker extends Object implements Runnable
The Worker class is meant to be spawned from the Plant class. A worker will have a job, which represents when to stop doing work on an Orange. The worker will get oranges to do work on from the takeQueue, and then add the oranges to the giveQueue when the worker is done doing its job on it.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Worker(int plantNum, int threadNum, BlockingQueue<Orange> takeQueue, BlockingQueue<Orange> giveQueue, Orange.State job)
    Creates a new Worker object.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    run()
    Runs this thread.
    void
    start()
    Starts thread by setting timeToWork to true and calling Thread.start().
    void
    stop()
    Stops thread from working by setting timeToWork to false, but doesn't stop thread from running.
    void
    waitToStop()
    Waits for thread to stop by calling Thread.join().

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Worker

      public Worker(int plantNum, int threadNum, BlockingQueue<Orange> takeQueue, BlockingQueue<Orange> giveQueue, Orange.State job)
      Creates a new Worker object.
      Parameters:
      plantNum - Number of plant this worker is working in, used to name worker thread.
      threadNum - Number of thread/worker.
      takeQueue - Queue to take oranges from.
      giveQueue - Queue to add oranges to after the workers job is complete
      job - The worker will process an orange until it's Orange.State equals job.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts thread by setting timeToWork to true and calling Thread.start().

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops thread from working by setting timeToWork to false, but doesn't stop thread from running. (To stop thread from running, call waitToStop())

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs this thread. While timeToWork is true, the thread will repeatedly take oranges from it's takeQueue, process the Orange until the threads given job is done, and then pass the orange off to it's giveQueue.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • waitToStop

      public void waitToStop()
      Waits for thread to stop by calling Thread.join().
